text: thanks Jordan, then is mostly about choosing the trigger and set it up to manage the send out. I thank you again for your help

Hi All,
A question about workflows.
A customer asked me to create a workflow that assign leads to different AEs randomly.
I know there's an external app called Round Robin for that <https://app.HubSpot.com/ecosystem/7697439/marketplace/apps/sales/sales-enablement/round-robin-lead-assignment-1208675>
But it's too expensive.
Does anyone have an idea for a workaround to do that?

Thanks!
Does the “Rotate record to owner” action work in this case?

Sure you can use the split test automation free app from the marketplace and set the split to the number of users you're splitting leads for.

There are more intricate ways as well, but it's a simple and effective tool.

Hello everyone! Im working on a custom workflow action, and for that purpose I need a post action execution so I can assign the call return value to an output field.
However, as you can see on the print screen, when I try to create such function, the creation returns me a blank array.
Any pointers?
Hmmm it seems I cant send images

So basically when I create the workflow action I have
`"functions": [`
        `{`
            `"functionType": "POST_ACTION_EXECUTION",`
            `"functionSource": "exports.main = (event, callback) => {\r\n  callback({\r\n    outputFields: {\r\n      jira_project_id: \"example output value\"\r\n    }\r\n  });\r\n}"`
        `}`
the response of that call is
`"functions": []`
